title: Based on GOOGL’s 10-Q Cash Flow Statements, did the company's FCF Conversion of Net Income to Common improve or worsen YoY for the Q2-FY2025 period? By how much? Define FCF as OCF - Capex. Express your answer as a percentage, rounded to two decimal places.
description:
One first needs to extract H1 and Q1 figures for both FY2024 nad FY2025. Obtain Q2 figures for both fiscal years by differencing. Calculate the FCF conversion % by dividing CF by the company-reported Net Income to Common.
 
 FY2025
 
 H1 OCF = 63,897
 H1 CapEx = 39,643
 Q1 OCF = 36,150
 Q1 CapEx = 17,197
 Q2 OCF = 63,897 − 36,150 = 27,747
 Q2 CapEx = 39,643 − 17,197 = 22,446
 Q2 FCF (’25) = 27,747 − 22,446 = 5,301
 Q2 Net income to common = 28,196
 
 Q2-FY2025 FCF conversion = 5,301 / 28,196 = 18.80%
 
 FY2024
 
 H1 OCF = 55,488
 H1 CapEx = 25,198
 Q1 OCF = 28,848
 Q1 CapEx = 12,012
 Q2 OCF = 55,488 − 28,848 = 26,640
 Q2 CapEx = 25,198 − 12,012 = 13,186
 Q2 FCF (’24) = 26,640 − 13,186 = 13,454
 
 Q2 Net income to common = 23,619
 
 Q2-FY2024 FCF conversion = 13,454 / 23,619 = 56.96%
 
 YoY change (Q2-25 vs Q2-24)
 
 18.80% − 56.96% = −38.16 percentage points
 
 Conclude that FCF conversion worsened by 38.16%.

rubric.criteria: Recognizes that FCF needs to be computed by subtracting CapEx from OCF.
Recognizes that Q2 figures need to be obtained by differencing H1 and Q1
YoY change in FCF conversion (Q2-25 − Q2-24) = −38.16 percentage points
Final conclusion: FCF conversion worsened YoY by 38.16%
